001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.math.filter.Debouncer;
010import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.BooleanEvent;
011import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.event.EventLoop;
012import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command;
013import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler;
014import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.InstantCommand;
015import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem;
016import java.util.function.BiFunction;
017import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
018
019/**
020 * This class is a wrapper around {@link BooleanEvent}, providing an easy way to link commands to
021 * digital inputs.
022 *
023 * <p>This class is provided by the NewCommands VendorDep
024 */
025public class Trigger extends BooleanEvent {
026  /**
027   * Creates a new trigger with the given condition/digital signal.
028   *
029   * @param loop the loop that polls this trigger
030   * @param signal the digital signal represented.
031   */
032  public Trigger(EventLoop loop, BooleanSupplier signal) {
033    super(loop, signal);
034  }
035
036  /**
037   * Copies the BooleanEvent into a Trigger object.
038   *
039   * @param toCast the BooleanEvent
040   * @return a Trigger wrapping the given BooleanEvent
041   * @see BooleanEvent#castTo(BiFunction)
042   */
043  public static Trigger cast(BooleanEvent toCast) {
044    return toCast.castTo(Trigger::new);
045  }
046
047  /**
048   * Creates a new trigger with the given condition/digital signal.
049   *
050   * <p>Polled by the {@link CommandScheduler#getDefaultButtonLoop() default scheduler button loop}.
051   *
052   * @param signal the digital signal represented.
053   */
054  public Trigger(BooleanSupplier signal) {
055    this(CommandScheduler.getInstance().getDefaultButtonLoop(), signal);
056  }
057
058  /** Creates a new trigger that is always inactive. */
059  @Deprecated
060  public Trigger() {
061    this(() -> false);
062  }
063
064  /**
065   * Returns whether or not the trigger is active.
066   *
067   * <p>This method will be called repeatedly a command is linked to the Trigger.
068   *
069   * <p>Functionally identical to {@link Trigger#getAsBoolean()}.
070   *
071   * @return whether or not the trigger condition is active.
072   * @deprecated use {@link #getAsBoolean()}
073   */
074  @Deprecated
075  public final boolean get() {
076    return getAsBoolean();
077  }
078
079  /**
080   * Starts the given command whenever the trigger just becomes active.
081   *
082   * @param command the command to start
083   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
084   */
085  public Trigger whenActive(final Command command) {
086    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "whenActive");
087
088    this.rising().ifHigh(command::schedule);
089    return this;
090  }
091
092  /**
093   * Runs the given runnable whenever the trigger just becomes active.
094   *
095   * @param toRun the runnable to run
096   * @param requirements the required subsystems
097   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
098   */
099  public Trigger whenActive(final Runnable toRun, Subsystem... requirements) {
100    return whenActive(new InstantCommand(toRun, requirements));
101  }
102
103  /**
104   * Constantly starts the given command while the button is held.
105   *
106   * <p>{@link Command#schedule()} will be called repeatedly while the trigger is active, and will
107   * be canceled when the trigger becomes inactive.
108   *
109   * @param command the command to start
110   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
111   */
112  public Trigger whileActiveContinuous(final Command command) {
113    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "whileActiveContinuous");
114
115    this.ifHigh(command::schedule);
116    this.falling().ifHigh(command::cancel);
117
118    return this;
119  }
120
121  /**
122   * Constantly runs the given runnable while the button is held.
123   *
124   * @param toRun the runnable to run
125   * @param requirements the required subsystems
126   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
127   */
128  public Trigger whileActiveContinuous(final Runnable toRun, Subsystem... requirements) {
129    return whileActiveContinuous(new InstantCommand(toRun, requirements));
130  }
131
132  /**
133   * Starts the given command when the trigger initially becomes active, and ends it when it becomes
134   * inactive, but does not re-start it in-between.
135   *
136   * @param command the command to start
137   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
138   */
139  public Trigger whileActiveOnce(final Command command) {
140    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "whileActiveOnce");
141
142    this.rising().ifHigh(command::schedule);
143    this.falling().ifHigh(command::cancel);
144
145    return this;
146  }
147
148  /**
149   * Starts the command when the trigger becomes inactive.
150   *
151   * @param command the command to start
152   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
153   */
154  public Trigger whenInactive(final Command command) {
155    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "whenInactive");
156
157    this.falling().ifHigh(command::schedule);
158
159    return this;
160  }
161
162  /**
163   * Runs the given runnable when the trigger becomes inactive.
164   *
165   * @param toRun the runnable to run
166   * @param requirements the required subsystems
167   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
168   */
169  public Trigger whenInactive(final Runnable toRun, Subsystem... requirements) {
170    return whenInactive(new InstantCommand(toRun, requirements));
171  }
172
173  /**
174   * Toggles a command when the trigger becomes active.
175   *
176   * @param command the command to toggle
177   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
178   */
179  public Trigger toggleWhenActive(final Command command) {
180    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "toggleWhenActive");
181
182    this.rising()
183        .ifHigh(
184            () -> {
185              if (command.isScheduled()) {
186                command.cancel();
187              } else {
188                command.schedule();
189              }
190            });
191
192    return this;
193  }
194
195  /**
196   * Cancels a command when the trigger becomes active.
197   *
198   * @param command the command to cancel
199   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
200   */
201  public Trigger cancelWhenActive(final Command command) {
202    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "cancelWhenActive");
203
204    this.rising().ifHigh(command::cancel);
205
206    return this;
207  }
208
209  /* ----------- Super method type redeclarations ----------------- */
210
211  @Override
212  public Trigger and(BooleanSupplier trigger) {
213    return cast(super.and(trigger));
214  }
215
216  @Override
217  public Trigger or(BooleanSupplier trigger) {
218    return cast(super.or(trigger));
219  }
220
221  @Override
222  public Trigger negate() {
223    return cast(super.negate());
224  }
225
226  @Override
227  public Trigger debounce(double seconds) {
228    return debounce(seconds, Debouncer.DebounceType.kRising);
229  }
230
231  @Override
232  public Trigger debounce(double seconds, Debouncer.DebounceType type) {
233    return cast(super.debounce(seconds, type));
234  }
235
236  @Override
237  public Trigger rising() {
238    return cast(super.rising());
239  }
240
241  @Override
242  public Trigger falling() {
243    return cast(super.falling());
244  }
245}
